column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=6 .
#Text=Angiogenesis in Glioblastomas
#Text=Features of glioblastomas are a high propensity to invade the surrounding tissues and extensive angiogenesis .

#Text=They are characterized by a pathological vascular system with a dense network of winding vessels of different diameters , increased permeability , and with abnormally thickened basement membranes .
#Text=These properties are often the cause of relapses and therapy failures because they hinder tumor access to cytotoxic chemotherapy .

#Text=Angiogenesis caused by the presence of a tumor is defined as the formation of new blood vessels based on existing ones , which can be visualized using ultra-high-field magnetic resonance angiography .
#Text=The mechanism of this process is very complex .

#Text=In GBM , the development of pathological vasculature is based on changes in adhesion molecules on the endothelial surface , the presence of an erratic basement membrane , a decrease in pericyte coverage , and a weaker binding of astrocytes to blood vessels .

#Text=A common element for the large invasiveness and angiogenesis of glioblastomas is the loss of tumor cell boundaries with the surrounding microenvironment consisting of brain tissue , subarachnoid space , and blood vessels .
#Text=Angiogenesis occurs under the influence of various mechanisms , which we divide into hypoxia-dependent and hypoxia-independent .
#Text=Hypoxia has been proven to inactivate prolyl hydroxylases .
#Text=This increases the level of hypoxia-inducible factor-1α ( HIF-1α ) , causing the release of vascular endothelial growth factor ( VEGF ) by glioma cells affected by hypoxia .
#Text=The task of VEGF is to counteract oxygen deficiency by inducing vascular network growth .
#Text=In spite of this , hypoxia may not be the only trigger factor for angiogenesis .
#Text=This applies particularly to the initial stages of carcinogenesis , when cell hypoxia is not yet severe .
#Text=Regulation of VEGF secretion also takes place by a mechanism independent of hypoxia , involving dysregulated activation of mitogenic and survival pathways .
#Text=This applies to phosphatidylinositol 3-kinase and Ras/mitogen-activated protein kinase .
#Text=The PD-L1/PD-1 axis may also have roles in regulating the level of VEGF mediating angiogenesis .
#Text=In studies conducted by Shin et al. , a positive correlation between PDL1 levels and VEGF expression was shown in 197 patients with renal cell carcinoma .
#Text=Similar observations were noted by Song et al.
#Text=The study was conducted in 64 patients with primary glioma .
#Text=Also , they showed that PD-L1 expression levels correlated well with VEGF levels .
#Text=However , not all studies agreed on this point .
#Text=Research by Joseph et al. indicates the existence of a negative relationship between VEGF-related genes and the activity of the PD-L1/PD1 axis .
#Text=A thorough understanding of the nature of this relationship requires further work .
#Text=EGF is another molecule with similar effects .
#Text=It promotes tumor angiogenesis as well as an increase in cell motility and invasiveness .
#Text=This is done by phosphorylating the EGFR receptor and activating further signaling pathways .
#Text=It has been shown that both EGFR and its mutated form of EGFRvIII promote GBM angiogenesis .
#Text=To allow vasculature growth and tumor invasion , it is necessary to reduce the integrity of the tumor microenvironment .

#Text=The pathophysiology of this process is based on EGFR inducing an increase in the activity of some proteases , thereby causing the breakdown of collagen , fibronectin , and other basement membrane structures .
#Text=The result is a loss of microenvironment integrity , an increase in tumor cell invasion into surrounding tissues and vessels , and an increase in angiogenesis .
#Text=The proteases whose activity is influenced by EGFR include , among others :
#Text=Serine Proteases
#Text=Matrix Metalloproteases ( MMPs )
#Text=Cysteine Proteases .
#Text=Serine proteases are a large group of proteases which include tissue plasminogen activator ( tPA ) and urokinase plasminogen activator ( uPA ) with its receptor ( uPAR ) .
#Text=Their activation affects the degradation of the extracellular space by tumors , promoting their invasiveness .
#Text=It has been shown that , the PAI-1 molecule mediates the regulation of the uPA/uPAR pathway in astrocytoma cells .
#Text=Its expression is promoted by an increase in EGF and inflammatory cytokines .
#Text=This results in greater uPA/uPAR activity , thus increasing tumor invasiveness .
#Text=Upregulation of uPA and uPAR is also achieved through the expression of the EGFR ligand transforming growth factor ( TGFα ) .
#Text=Studies confirmed that in malignant gliomas , both PAI-1 and EGFR activity correlate with higher tumor malignancy and worse prognosis for patients .
#Text=EGF also has a potential impact on another group of proteases , i. e. , MMPs .
#Text=They are a large group of enzymes whose effect is based on the regulation of metabolism and cell morphogenesis .
#Text=Disruption of their function also affects the loss of cell integrity .

#Text=It has been shown that the activity of certain matrix metalloproteases , such as MMP-2 ( gelatinase A ) , MMP-9 ( gelatinase B ) , MMP-14 ( matrix metalloproteinase 14 ) is related to the pathophysiology of high-grade gliomas .
#Text=It correlates with the severity of tumor invasion and its degree of malignancy .
#Text=Another group of proteases are cysteine proteases , examples of which are cathepsins .
#Text=These include , among others , cathepsin B , involved in the degradation of the tumor microenvironment .
#Text=Its expression ( mRNA level ) has been shown to correlate with EGFR expression level .
#Text=It was also confirmed that its presence is increased in gliomas .
#Text=The action of cathepsin B may be bidirectional .
#Text=It promotes the degradation of the integrity of the environment of the tumor directly or through intermediate mediators such as uPA , MMPs , or plasmin .
